SUMMARY: Carbohydrate diacid regulator, CdaR, or sugar diacid regulator, SdaR, regulates genes involved in uptake and metabolism of galactarate and glucarate, and it is also autoregulated [10762278]. SdaR responds to d-galactarate and d-glucarate, and even better to d-glycerate to activate genes it regulates [10762278]. In addition, it was found that 2-O-Î±-mannosyl-d-glycerate (MG) can induce SdaR regulon [14645248] MG has been recognized as a protective osmolyte in hyperrmophylic prokaryotes and as a carbon source for Escherichia coli [14645248]. This protein has a helix-turn-helix motif for DNA binding in C-terminal domain [10762278]. exact position and sequence that SdaR binds to in DNA have not been yet determined.
